Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה֙ הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּשִׂ֖ים לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translit: vəʾēlleh hammishpåṭîm ʾasher tåsîm lifnēhem
English: Now these are the judgments which thou shalt set before them.

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תִקְנֶה֙ עֶ֣בֶד עִבְרִ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים יַעֲבֹ֑ד וּבַ֨שְּׁבִעִ֔ת יֵצֵ֥א לַֽחָפְשִׁ֖י חִנָּֽם׃
Translit: kî thiqneh ʿevedh ʿivrî shēsh shånîm yaʿavōdh ūvasshəviʿith yētṣēʾ laḥåfshî ḥinnåm
English: If thou buy an Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.

Hebrew: אִם־בְּגַפּ֥וֹ יָבֹ֖א בְּגַפּ֣וֹ יֵצֵ֑א אִם־בַּ֤עַל אִשָּׁה֙ ה֔וּא וְיָצְאָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾim-bəghappō yåvōʾ bəghappō yētṣēʾ ʾim-baʿal ʾisshåh hūʾ vəyåtṣʾåh ʾishtō ʿimmō-
English: If he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself: if he were married, then his wife shall go out with him.

Hebrew: אִם־אֲדֹנָיו֙ יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֔ה וְיָלְדָה־ל֥וֹ בָנִ֖ים א֣וֹ בָנ֑וֹת הָאִשָּׁ֣ה וִילָדֶ֗יהָ תִּהְיֶה֙ לַֽאדֹנֶ֔יהָ וְה֖וּא יֵצֵ֥א בְגַפּֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾim-ʾadhōnåv yitten-lō ʾisshåh vəyåldhåh-lō vånîm ʾō vånōth håʾisshåh vîlådhehå tihyeh laʾdhōnehå vəhūʾ yētṣēʾ vəghappō-
English: If his master have given him a wife, and she have born him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master's, and he shall go out by himself.

Hebrew: וְאִם־אָמֹ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אָהַ֨בְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֔י אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֖י וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑י לֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א חָפְשִֽׁי׃
Translit: vəʾim-ʾåmōr yōʾmar håʿevedh ʾåhavtî ʾeth-ʾadhōnî ʾeth-ʾishtî vəʾeth-bånåi lōʾ ʾētṣēʾ ḥåfshî-
English: And if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free:

Hebrew: וְהִגִּישׁ֤וֹ אֲדֹנָיו֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהִגִּישׁוֹ֙ אֶל־הַדֶּ֔לֶת א֖וֹ אֶל־הַמְּזוּזָ֑ה וְרָצַ֨ע אֲדֹנָ֤יו אֶת־אָזְנוֹ֙ בַּמַּרְצֵ֔עַ וַעֲבָד֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽם׃
Translit: vəhiggîshō ʾadhōnåv ʾel-håʾelōhîm vəhiggîshō ʾel-haddeleth ʾō ʾel-hamməzūzåh vəråtṣaʿ ʾadhōnåv ʾeth-ʾåznō bammartṣēaʿ vaʿavådhō ləʿōlåm
English: Then his master shall bring him unto the judges; he shall also bring him to the door, or unto the door post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an aul; and he shall serve him for ever.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִמְכֹּ֥ר אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־בִּתּ֖וֹ לְאָמָ֑ה לֹ֥א תֵצֵ֖א כְּצֵ֥את הָעֲבָדִֽים׃
Translit: vəkhî-yimkōr ʾîsh ʾeth-bittō ləʾåmåh lōʾ thētṣēʾ kətṣēʾth håʿavådhîm-
English: And if a man sell his daughter to be a maidservant, she shall not go out as the menservants do.

Hebrew: אִם־רָעָ֞ה בְּעֵינֵ֧י אֲדֹנֶ֛יהָ אֲשֶׁר־לא ל֥וֹ יְעָדָ֖הּ וְהֶפְדָּ֑הּ לְעַ֥ם נָכְרִ֛י לֹא־יִמְשֹׁ֥ל לְמָכְרָ֖הּ בְּבִגְדוֹ־בָֽהּ׃
Translit: ʾim-råʿåh bəʿēnē ʾadhōnehå ʾasher-lʾ lō yəʿådhåhh vəhefdåhh ləʿam nåkhrî lōʾ-yimshōl ləmåkhråhh bəvighdhō-våhh-
English: If she please not her master, who hath betrothed her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a strange nation he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.

Hebrew: וְאִם־לִבְנ֖וֹ יִֽיעָדֶ֑נָּה כְּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַבָּנ֖וֹת יַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽהּ׃
Translit: vəʾim-livnō yîʿådhennåh kəmishpaṭ habbånōth yaʿaseh-låhh-
English: And if he have betrothed her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.

Hebrew: אִם־אַחֶ֖רֶת יִֽקַּֽח־ל֑וֹ שְׁאֵרָ֛הּ כְּסוּתָ֥הּ וְעֹנָתָ֖הּ לֹ֥א יִגְרָֽע׃
Translit: ʾim-ʾaḥereth yiqqaḥ-lō shəʾēråhh kəsūthåhh vəʿōnåthåhh lōʾ yighråʿ-
English: If he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.

Hebrew: וְאִם־שְׁלָ֨שׁ־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לָ֑הּ וְיָצְאָ֥ה חִנָּ֖ם אֵ֥ין כָּֽסֶף׃
Translit: vəʾim-shəlåsh-ʾēlleh lōʾ yaʿaseh låhh vəyåtṣʾåh ḥinnåm ʾēn kåsef-
English: And if he do not these three unto her, then shall she go out free without money.

Hebrew: מַכֵּ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ וָמֵ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: makkēh ʾîsh våmēth mōth yūmåth
English: He that smiteth a man, so that he die, shall be surely put to death.

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א צָדָ֔ה וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אִנָּ֣ה לְיָד֑וֹ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י לְךָ֙ מָק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנ֖וּס שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translit: vaʾasher lōʾ tṣådhåh vəhåʾelōhîm ʾinnåh ləyådhō vəsamtî ləkhå måqōm ʾasher yånūs shåmmåh
English: And if a man lie not in wait, but God deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָזִ֥ד אִ֛ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֖הוּ לְהָרְג֣וֹ בְעָרְמָ֑ה מֵעִ֣ם מִזְבְּחִ֔י תִּקָּחֶ֖נּוּ לָמֽוּת׃
Translit: vəkhî-yåzidh ʾîsh ʿal-rēʿēhū ləhårghō vəʿårmåh mēʿim mizbəḥî tiqqåḥennū låmūth-
English: But if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbour, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.

Hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: ūmakkēh ʾåvîv vəʾimmō mōth yūmåth
English: And he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.

Hebrew: וְגֹנֵ֨ב אִ֧ישׁ וּמְכָר֛וֹ וְנִמְצָ֥א בְיָד֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: vəghōnēv ʾîsh ūməkhårō vənimtṣåʾ vəyådhō mōth yūmåth
English: And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.

Hebrew: וּמְקַלֵּ֥ל אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: ūməqallēl ʾåvîv vəʾimmō mōth yūmåth
English: And he that curseth his father, or his mother, shall surely be put to death.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יְרִיבֻ֣ן אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְהִכָּה־אִישׁ֙ אֶת־רֵעֵ֔הוּ בְּאֶ֖בֶן א֣וֹ בְאֶגְרֹ֑ף וְלֹ֥א יָמ֖וּת וְנָפַ֥ל לְמִשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translit: vəkhî-yərîvun ʾanåshîm vəhikkåh-ʾîsh ʾeth-rēʿēhū bəʾeven ʾō vəʾeghrōf vəlōʾ yåmūth vənåfal ləmishkåv-
English: And if men strive together, and one smite another with a stone, or with his fist, and he die not, but keepeth his bed:

Hebrew: אִם־יָק֞וּם וְהִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּח֛וּץ עַל־מִשְׁעַנְתּ֖וֹ וְנִקָּ֣ה הַמַּכֶּ֑ה רַ֥ק שִׁבְתּ֛וֹ יִתֵּ֖ן וְרַפֹּ֥א יְרַפֵּֽא׃
Translit: ʾim-yåqūm vəhithhallēkh baḥūtṣ ʿal-mishʿantō vəniqqåh hammakkeh raq shivtō yittēn vərappōʾ yərappēʾ-
English: If he rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּה֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּ֜וֹ א֤וֹ אֶת־אֲמָתוֹ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔בֶט וּמֵ֖ת תַּ֣חַת יָד֑וֹ נָקֹ֖ם יִנָּקֵֽם׃
Translit: vəkhî-yakkeh ʾîsh ʾeth-ʿavdō ʾō ʾeth-ʾamåthō basshēveṭ ūmēth taḥath yådhō nåqōm yinnåqēm-
English: And if a man smite his servant, or his maid, with a rod, and he die under his hand; he shall be surely punished.

Hebrew: אַ֥ךְ אִם־י֛וֹם א֥וֹ יוֹמַ֖יִם יַעֲמֹ֑ד לֹ֣א יֻקַּ֔ם כִּ֥י כַסְפּ֖וֹ הֽוּא׃
Translit: ʾakh ʾim-yōm ʾō yōmayim yaʿamōdh lōʾ yuqqam kî khaspō hūʾ
English: Notwithstanding, if he continue a day or two, he shall not be punished: for he is his money.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִנָּצ֣וּ אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וְנָ֨גְפ֜וּ אִשָּׁ֤ה הָרָה֙ וְיָצְא֣וּ יְלָדֶ֔יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה אָס֑וֹן עָנ֣וֹשׁ יֵעָנֵ֗שׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׁ֤ית עָלָיו֙ בַּ֣עַל הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנָתַ֖ן בִּפְלִלִֽים׃
Translit: vəkhî-yinnåtṣū ʾanåshîm vənåghfū ʾisshåh håråh vəyåtṣʾū yəlådhehå vəlōʾ yihyeh ʾåsōn ʿånōsh yēʿånēsh kaʾasher yåshîth ʿålåv baʿal håʾisshåh vənåthan biflilîm-
English: If men strive, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit depart from her, and yet no mischief follow: he shall be surely punished, according as the woman's husband will lay upon him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.

Hebrew: וְאִם־אָס֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֥ה נֶ֖פֶשׁ תַּ֥חַת נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translit: vəʾim-ʾåsōn yihyeh vənåthattåh nefesh taḥath nåfesh-
English: And if any mischief follow, then thou shalt give life for life,

Hebrew: עַ֚יִן תַּ֣חַת עַ֔יִן שֵׁ֖ן תַּ֣חַת שֵׁ֑ן יָ֚ד תַּ֣חַת יָ֔ד רֶ֖גֶל תַּ֥חַת רָֽגֶל׃
Translit: ʿayin taḥath ʿayin shēn taḥath shēn yådh taḥath yådh reghel taḥath råghel
English: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,

Hebrew: כְּוִיָּה֙ תַּ֣חַת כְּוִיָּ֔ה פֶּ֖צַע תַּ֣חַת פָּ֑צַע חַבּוּרָ֕ה תַּ֖חַת חַבּוּרָֽה׃
Translit: kəviyyåh taḥath kəviyyåh petṣaʿ taḥath påtṣaʿ ḥabbūråh taḥath ḥabbūråh
English: Burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּ֨ה אִ֜ישׁ אֶת־עֵ֥ין עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־אֶת־עֵ֥ין אֲמָת֖וֹ וְשִֽׁחֲתָ֑הּ לַֽחָפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת עֵינֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəkhî-yakkeh ʾîsh ʾeth-ʿēn ʿavdō ʾō-ʾeth-ʿēn ʾamåthō vəshiḥathåhh laḥåfshî yəshalləḥennū taḥath ʿēnō-
English: And if a man smite the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid, that it perish; he shall let him go free for his eye's sake.

Hebrew: וְאִם־שֵׁ֥ן עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־שֵׁ֥ן אֲמָת֖וֹ יַפִּ֑יל לַֽחָפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת שִׁנּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʾim-shēn ʿavdō ʾō-shēn ʾamåthō yappîl laḥåfshî yəshalləḥennū taḥath shinnō-
English: And if he smite out his manservant's tooth, or his maidservant's tooth; he shall let him go free for his tooth's sake.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִגַּ֨ח שׁ֥וֹר אֶת־אִ֛ישׁ א֥וֹ אֶת־אִשָּׁ֖ה וָמֵ֑ת סָק֨וֹל יִסָּקֵ֜ל הַשּׁ֗וֹר וְלֹ֤א יֵאָכֵל֙ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וּבַ֥עַל הַשּׁ֖וֹר נָקִֽי׃
Translit: vəkhî-yiggaḥ shōr ʾeth-ʾîsh ʾō ʾeth-ʾisshåh våmēth såqōl yissåqēl hasshōr vəlōʾ yēʾåkhēl ʾeth-bəsårō ūvaʿal hasshōr nåqî-
English: If an ox gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall be surely stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.

Hebrew: וְאִ֡ם שׁוֹר֩ נַגָּ֨ח ה֜וּא מִתְּמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֗ם וְהוּעַ֤ד בִּבְעָלָיו֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְרֶ֔נּוּ וְהֵמִ֥ית אִ֖ישׁ א֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֑ה הַשּׁוֹר֙ יִסָּקֵ֔ל וְגַם־בְּעָלָ֖יו יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: vəʾim shōr naggåḥ hūʾ mittəmōl shilshōm vəhūʿadh bivʿålåv vəlōʾ yishmərennū vəhēmîth ʾîsh ʾō ʾisshåh hasshōr yissåqēl vəgham-bəʿålåv yūmåth
English: But if the ox were wont to push with his horn in time past, and it hath been testified to his owner, and he hath not kept him in, but that he hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֖פֶר יוּשַׁ֣ת עָלָ֑יו וְנָתַן֙ פִּדְיֹ֣ן נַפְשׁ֔וֹ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יוּשַׁ֖ת עָלָֽיו׃
Translit: ʾim-kōfer yūshath ʿålåv vənåthan pidhyōn nafshō kəkhōl ʾasher-yūshath ʿålåv-
English: If there be laid on him a sum of money, then he shall give for the ransom of his life whatsoever is laid upon him.

Hebrew: אוֹ־בֵ֥ן יִגָּ֖ח אוֹ־בַ֣ת יִגָּ֑ח כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט הַזֶּ֖ה יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾō-vēn yiggåḥ ʾō-vath yiggåḥ kammishpåṭ hazzeh yēʿåseh lō-
English: Whether he have gored a son, or have gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done unto him.

Hebrew: אִם־עֶ֛בֶד יִגַּ֥ח הַשּׁ֖וֹר א֣וֹ אָמָ֑ה כֶּ֣סֶף שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֗ים יִתֵּן֙ לַֽאדֹנָ֔יו וְהַשּׁ֖וֹר יִסָּקֵֽל׃
Translit: ʾim-ʿevedh yiggaḥ hasshōr ʾō ʾåmåh kesef shəlōshîm shəqålîm yittēn laʾdhōnåv vəhasshōr yissåqēl-
English: If the ox shall push a manservant or a maidservant; he shall give unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִפְתַּ֨ח אִ֜ישׁ בּ֗וֹר א֠וֹ כִּֽי־יִכְרֶ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ בֹּ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יְכַסֶּ֑נּוּ וְנָֽפַל־שָׁ֥מָּה שּׁ֖וֹר א֥וֹ חֲמֽוֹר׃
Translit: vəkhî-yiftaḥ ʾîsh bōr ʾō kî-yikhreh ʾîsh bōr vəlōʾ yəkhassennū vənåfal-shåmmåh shōr ʾō ḥamōr-
English: And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit, and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein;

Hebrew: בַּ֤עַל הַבּוֹר֙ יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם כֶּ֖סֶף יָשִׁ֣יב לִבְעָלָ֑יו וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃
Translit: baʿal habbōr yəshallēm kesef yåshîv livʿålåv vəhammēth yihyeh-lō
English: The owner of the pit shall make it good, and give money unto the owner of them; and the dead beast shall be his.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִגֹּ֧ף שֽׁוֹר־אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־שׁ֥וֹר רֵעֵ֖הוּ וָמֵ֑ת וּמָ֨כְר֜וּ אֶת־הַשּׁ֤וֹר הַחַי֙ וְחָצ֣וּ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַמֵּ֖ת יֶֽחֱצֽוּן׃
Translit: vəkhî-yiggōf shōr-ʾîsh ʾeth-shōr rēʿēhū våmēth ūmåkhrū ʾeth-hasshōr haḥai vəḥåtṣū ʾeth-kaspō vəgham ʾeth-hammēth yeḥetṣūn-
English: And if one man's ox hurt another's, that he die; then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the money of it; and the dead ox also they shall divide.

Hebrew: א֣וֹ נוֹדַ֗ע כִּ֠י שׁ֣וֹר נַגָּ֥ח הוּא֙ מִתְּמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְרֶ֖נּוּ בְּעָלָ֑יו שַׁלֵּ֨ם יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שׁוֹר֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾō nōdhaʿ kî shōr naggåḥ hūʾ mittəmōl shilshōm vəlōʾ yishmərennū bəʿålåv shallēm yəshallēm shōr taḥath hasshōr vəhammēth yihyeh-lō
English: Or if it be known that the ox hath used to push in time past, and his owner hath not kept him in; he shall surely pay ox for ox; and the dead shall be his own.

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יִגְנֹֽב־אִישׁ֙ שׁ֣וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֔ה וּטְבָח֖וֹ א֣וֹ מְכָר֑וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בָקָ֗ר יְשַׁלֵּם֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְאַרְבַּע־צֹ֖אן תַּ֥חַת הַשֶּֽׂה׃
Translit: kî yighnōv-ʾîsh shōr ʾō-seh ūṭəvåḥō ʾō məkhårō ḥamisshåh våqår yəshallēm taḥath hasshōr vəʾarbaʿ-tṣōʾn taḥath hasseh
English: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.

Hebrew: אִם־בַּמַּחְתֶּ֛רֶת יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב וְהֻכָּ֣ה וָמֵ֑ת אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּמִֽים׃
Translit: ʾim-bammaḥtereth yimmåtṣēʾ haggannåv vəhukkåh våmēth ʾēn lō dåmîm-
English: If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.

Hebrew: אִם־זָרְחָ֥ה הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ עָלָ֖יו דָּמִ֣ים ל֑וֹ שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם אִם־אֵ֣ין ל֔וֹ וְנִמְכַּ֖ר בִּגְנֵבָתֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾim-zårḥåh hasshemesh ʿålåv dåmîm lō shallēm yəshallēm ʾim-ʾēn lō vənimkar bighnēvåthō-
English: If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him; for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.

Hebrew: אִֽם־הִמָּצֵא֩ תִמָּצֵ֨א בְיָד֜וֹ הַגְּנֵבָ֗ה מִשּׁ֧וֹר עַד־חֲמ֛וֹר עַד־שֶׂ֖ה חַיִּ֑ים שְׁנַ֖יִם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translit: ʾim-himmåtṣēʾ thimmåtṣēʾ vəyådhō haggənēvåh misshōr ʿadh-ḥamōr ʿadh-seh ḥayyîm shənayim yəshallēm-
English: If the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יַבְעֶר־אִישׁ֙ שָׂדֶ֣ה אוֹ־כֶ֔רֶם וְשִׁלַּח֙ אֶת־בעירה בְּעִיר֔וֹ וּבִעֵ֖ר בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה אַחֵ֑ר מֵיטַ֥ב שָׂדֵ֛הוּ וּמֵיטַ֥ב כַּרְמ֖וֹ יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translit: kî yavʿer-ʾîsh sådheh ʾō-kherem vəshillaḥ ʾeth-vʿyrh bəʿîrō ūviʿēr bisdhēh ʾaḥēr mēṭav sådhēhū ūmēṭav karmō yəshallēm
English: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man's field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֨א אֵ֜שׁ וּמָצְאָ֤ה קֹצִים֙ וְנֶאֱכַ֣ל גָּדִ֔ישׁ א֥וֹ הַקָּמָ֖ה א֣וֹ הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם הַמַּבְעִ֖ר אֶת־הַבְּעֵרָֽה׃
Translit: kî-thētṣēʾ ʾēsh ūmåtṣʾåh qōtṣîm vəneʾekhal gådhîsh ʾō haqqåmåh ʾō hassådheh shallēm yəshallēm hammavʿir ʾeth-habbəʿēråh-
English: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ כֶּ֤סֶף אֽוֹ־כֵלִים֙ לִשְׁמֹ֔ר וְגֻנַּ֖ב מִבֵּ֣ית הָאִ֑ישׁ אִם־יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנָֽיִם׃
Translit: kî-yittēn ʾîsh ʾel-rēʿēhū kesef ʾō-khēlîm lishmōr vəghunnav mibbēth håʾîsh ʾim-yimmåtṣēʾ haggannåv yəshallēm shənåyim-
English: If a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man's house; if the thief be found, let him pay double.

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֤א יִמָּצֵא֙ הַגַּנָּ֔ב וְנִקְרַ֥ב בַּֽעַל־הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֥אכֶת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translit: ʾim-lōʾ yimmåtṣēʾ haggannåv vəniqrav baʿal-habbayith ʾel-håʾelōhîm ʾim-lōʾ shålaḥ yådhō bimleʾkheth rēʿēhū-
English: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put his hand unto his neighbour's goods.

Hebrew: עַֽל־כָּל־דְּבַר־פֶּ֡שַׁע עַל־שׁ֡וֹר עַל־חֲ֠מוֹר עַל־שֶׂ֨ה עַל־שַׂלְמָ֜ה עַל־כָּל־אֲבֵדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ כִּי־ה֣וּא זֶ֔ה עַ֚ד הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים יָבֹ֖א דְּבַר־שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַרְשִׁיעֻן֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translit: ʿal-kål-dəvar-peshaʿ ʿal-shōr ʿal-ḥamōr ʿal-seh ʿal-salmåh ʿal-kål-ʾavēdhåh ʾasher yōʾmar kî-hūʾ zeh ʿadh håʾelōhîm yåvōʾ dəvar-shənēhem ʾasher yarshîʿun ʾelōhîm yəshallēm shənayim lərēʿēhū-
English: For all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ חֲמ֨וֹר אוֹ־שׁ֥וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֛ה וְכָל־בְּהֵמָ֖ה לִשְׁמֹ֑ר וּמֵ֛ת אוֹ־נִשְׁבַּ֥ר אוֹ־נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אֵ֥ין רֹאֶֽה׃
Translit: kî-yittēn ʾîsh ʾel-rēʿēhū ḥamōr ʾō-shōr ʾō-seh vəkhål-bəhēmåh lishmōr ūmēth ʾō-nishbar ʾō-nishbåh ʾēn rōʾeh-
English: If a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:

Hebrew: שְׁבֻעַ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה תִּהְיֶה֙ בֵּ֣ין שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֣אכֶת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְלָקַ֥ח בְּעָלָ֖יו וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translit: shəvuʿath ʾadhōnåi tihyeh bēn shənēhem ʾim-lōʾ shålaḥ yådhō bimleʾkheth rēʿēhū vəlåqaḥ bəʿålåv vəlōʾ yəshallēm
English: Then shall an oath of the LORD be between them both, that he hath not put his hand unto his neighbour's goods; and the owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.

Hebrew: וְאִם־גָּנֹ֥ב יִגָּנֵ֖ב מֵעִמּ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לִבְעָלָֽיו׃
Translit: vəʾim-gånōv yiggånēv mēʿimmō yəshallēm livʿålåv-
English: And if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.

Hebrew: אִם־טָרֹ֥ף יִטָּרֵ֖ף יְבִאֵ֣הוּ עֵ֑ד הַטְּרֵפָ֖ה לֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translit: ʾim-ṭårōf yiṭṭårēf yəviʾēhū ʿēdh haṭṭərēfåh lōʾ yəshallēm-
English: If it be torn in pieces, then let him bring it for witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִשְׁאַ֥ל אִ֛ישׁ מֵעִ֥ם רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ר אוֹ־מֵ֑ת בְּעָלָ֥יו אֵין־עִמּ֖וֹ שַׁלֵּ֥ם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translit: vəkhî-yishʾal ʾîsh mēʿim rēʿēhū vənishbar ʾō-mēth bəʿålåv ʾēn-ʿimmō shallēm yəshallēm-
English: And if a man borrow ought of his neighbour, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good.

Hebrew: אִם־בְּעָלָ֥יו עִמּ֖וֹ לֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם אִם־שָׂכִ֣יר ה֔וּא בָּ֖א בִּשְׂכָרֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾim-bəʿålåv ʿimmō lōʾ yəshallēm ʾim-såkhîr hūʾ båʾ biskhårō-
English: But if the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יְפַתֶּ֣ה אִ֗ישׁ בְּתוּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־אֹרָ֖שָׂה וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ מָהֹ֛ר יִמְהָרֶ֥נָּה לּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translit: vəkhî-yəfatteh ʾîsh bəthūlåh ʾasher lōʾ-ʾōråsåh vəshåkhav ʿimmåhh måhōr yimhårennåh lō ləʾisshåh-
English: And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.

Hebrew: אִם־מָאֵ֧ן יְמָאֵ֛ן אָבִ֖יהָ לְתִתָּ֣הּ ל֑וֹ כֶּ֣סֶף יִשְׁקֹ֔ל כְּמֹ֖הַר הַבְּתוּלֹֽת׃
Translit: ʾim-måʾēn yəmåʾēn ʾåvîhå ləthittåhh lō kesef yishqōl kəmōhar habbəthūlōth-
English: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.

Hebrew: מְכַשֵּׁפָ֖ה לֹ֥א תְחַיֶּֽה׃
Translit: məkhasshēfåh lōʾ thəḥayyeh
English: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.

Hebrew: כָּל־שֹׁכֵ֥ב עִם־בְּהֵמָ֖ה מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: kål-shōkhēv ʿim-bəhēmåh mōth yūmåth-
English: Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.

Hebrew: זֹבֵ֥חַ לָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יָֽחֳרָ֑ם בִּלְתִּ֥י לַיהוָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translit: zōvēaḥ låʾelōhîm yåḥoråm biltî laʾdhōnåi ləvaddō
English: He that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto the LORD only, he shall be utterly destroyed.

Hebrew: וְגֵ֥ר לֹא־תוֹנֶ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תִלְחָצֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vəghēr lōʾ-thōneh vəlōʾ thilḥåtṣennū kî-ghērîm heyîthem bəʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Hebrew: כָּל־אַלְמָנָ֥ה וְיָת֖וֹם לֹ֥א תְעַנּֽוּן׃
Translit: kål-ʾalmånåh vəyåthōm lōʾ thəʿannūn-
English: Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.

Hebrew: אִם־עַנֵּ֥ה תְעַנֶּ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י אִם־צָעֹ֤ק יִצְעַק֙ אֵלַ֔י שָׁמֹ֥עַ אֶשְׁמַ֖ע צַעֲקָתֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾim-ʿannēh thəʿanneh ʾōthō kî ʾim-tṣåʿōq yitṣʿaq ʾēlai shåmōaʿ ʾeshmaʿ tṣaʿaqåthō-
English: If thou afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;

Hebrew: וְחָרָ֣ה אַפִּ֔י וְהָרַגְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם בֶּחָ֑רֶב וְהָי֤וּ נְשֵׁיכֶם֙ אַלְמָנ֔וֹת וּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם יְתֹמִֽים׃
Translit: vəḥåråh ʾappî vəhåraghtî ʾethkhem beḥårev vəhåiū nəshēkhem ʾalmånōth ūvənēkhem yəthōmîm
English: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

Hebrew: אִם־כֶּ֣סֶף תַּלְוֶ֣ה אֶת־עַמִּ֗י אֶת־הֶֽעָנִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה ל֖וֹ כְּנֹשֶׁ֑ה לֹֽא־תְשִׂימ֥וּן עָלָ֖יו נֶֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translit: ʾim-kesef talveh ʾeth-ʿammî ʾeth-heʿånî ʿimmåkh lōʾ-thihyeh lō kənōsheh lōʾ-thəsîmūn ʿålåv neshekh-
English: If thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.

Hebrew: אִם־חָבֹ֥ל תַּחְבֹּ֖ל שַׂלְמַ֣ת רֵעֶ֑ךָ עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ תְּשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾim-ḥåvōl taḥbōl salmath rēʿekhå ʿadh-bōʾ hasshemesh təshîvennū lō-
English: If thou at all take thy neighbour's raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him by that the sun goeth down:

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הִ֤וא כסותה כְסוּתוֹ֙ לְבַדָּ֔הּ הִ֥וא שִׂמְלָת֖וֹ לְעֹר֑וֹ בַּמֶּ֣ה יִשְׁכָּ֔ב וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־יִצְעַ֣ק אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁמַעְתִּ֖י כִּֽי־חַנּ֥וּן אָֽנִי׃
Translit: kî hivʾ khsvthh khəsūthō ləvaddåhh hivʾ simlåthō ləʿōrō bammeh yishkåv vəhåyåh kî-yitṣʿaq ʾēlai vəshåmaʿtî kî-ḥannūn ʾånî
English: For that is his covering only, it is his raiment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א תְקַלֵּ֑ל וְנָשִׂ֥יא בְעַמְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א תָאֹֽר׃
Translit: ʾelōhîm lōʾ thəqallēl vənåsîʾ vəʿamməkhå lōʾ thåʾōr
English: Thou shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people.

Hebrew: מְלֵאָתְךָ֥ וְדִמְעֲךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְאַחֵ֑ר בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לִּֽי׃
Translit: məlēʾåthkhå vədhimʿakhå lōʾ thəʾaḥēr bəkhōr bånekhå titten-lî
English: Thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, and of thy liquors: the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.

Hebrew: כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְשֹׁרְךָ֖ לְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה עִם־אִמּ֔וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י תִּתְּנוֹ־לִֽי׃
Translit: kēn-taʿaseh ləshōrəkhå lətṣōʾnekhå shivʿath yåmîm yihyeh ʿim-ʾimmō bayyōm hasshəmînî tittənō-lî-
English: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.

Hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְי֣וּן לִ֑י וּבָשָׂ֨ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֤ה טְרֵפָה֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ לַכֶּ֖לֶב תַּשְׁלִכ֥וּן אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʾanshē-qōdhesh tihyūn lî ūvåsår bassådheh ṭərēfåh lōʾ thōʾkhēlū lakkelev tashlikhūn ʾōthō-
English: And ye shall be holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֖א שֵׁ֣מַע שָׁ֑וְא אַל־תָּ֤שֶׁת יָֽדְךָ֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע לִהְיֹ֖ת עֵ֥ד חָמָֽס׃
Translit: lōʾ thissåʾ shēmaʿ shåvʾ ʾal-tåsheth yådhkhå ʿim-råshåʿ lihyōth ʿēdh ḥåmås
English: Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרֵֽי־רַבִּ֖ים לְרָעֹ֑ת וְלֹא־תַעֲנֶ֣ה עַל־רִ֗ב לִנְטֹ֛ת אַחֲרֵ֥י רַבִּ֖ים לְהַטֹּֽת׃
Translit: lōʾ-thihyeh ʾaḥarē-rabbîm ləråʿōth vəlōʾ-thaʿaneh ʿal-riv linṭōth ʾaḥarē rabbîm ləhaṭṭōth-
English: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:

Hebrew: וְדָ֕ל לֹ֥א תֶהְדַּ֖ר בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃
Translit: vədhål lōʾ thehdar bərîvō
English: Neither shalt thou countenance a poor man in his cause.

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִפְגַּ֞ע שׁ֧וֹר אֹֽיִבְךָ֛ א֥וֹ חֲמֹר֖וֹ תֹּעֶ֑ה הָשֵׁ֥ב תְּשִׁיבֶ֖נּוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translit: kî thifgaʿ shōr ʾōyivkhå ʾō ḥamōrō tōʿeh håshēv təshîvennū lō
English: If thou meet thine enemy's ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִרְאֶ֞ה חֲמ֣וֹר שֹׂנַאֲךָ֗ רֹבֵץ֙ תַּ֣חַת מַשָּׂא֔וֹ וְחָדַלְתָּ֖ מֵעֲזֹ֣ב ל֑וֹ עָזֹ֥ב תַּעֲזֹ֖ב עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translit: kî-thirʾeh ḥamōr sōnaʾakhå rōvētṣ taḥath massåʾō vəḥådhaltå mēʿazōv lō ʿåzōv taʿazōv ʿimmō-
English: If thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, and wouldest forbear to help him, thou shalt surely help with him.

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַטֶּ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט אֶבְיֹנְךָ֖ בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃
Translit: lōʾ thaṭṭeh mishpaṭ ʾevyōnəkhå bərîvō
English: Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.

Hebrew: מִדְּבַר־שֶׁ֖קֶר תִּרְחָ֑ק וְנָקִ֤י וְצַדִּיק֙ אַֽל־תַּהֲרֹ֔ג כִּ֥י לֹא־אַצְדִּ֖יק רָשָֽׁע׃
Translit: middəvar-sheqer tirḥåq vənåqî vətṣaddîq ʾal-taharōgh kî lōʾ-ʾatṣdîq råshåʿ-
English: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

Hebrew: וְשֹׁ֖חַד לֹ֣א תִקָּ֑ח כִּ֤י הַשֹּׁ֨חַד֙ יְעַוֵּ֣ר פִּקְחִ֔ים וִֽיסַלֵּ֖ף דִּבְרֵ֥י צַדִּיקִֽים׃
Translit: vəshōḥadh lōʾ thiqqåḥ kî hasshōḥadh yəʿavvēr piqḥîm vîsallēf divrē tṣaddîqîm
English: And thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.

Hebrew: וְגֵ֖ר לֹ֣א תִלְחָ֑ץ וְאַתֶּ֗ם יְדַעְתֶּם֙ אֶת־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַגֵּ֔ר כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vəghēr lōʾ thilḥåtṣ vəʾattem yədhaʿtem ʾeth-nefesh haggēr kî-ghērîm heyîthem bəʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים תִּזְרַ֣ע אֶת־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
Translit: vəshēsh shånîm tizraʿ ʾeth-ʾartṣekhå vəʾåsaftå ʾeth-təvūʾåthåhh
English: And six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the fruits thereof:

Hebrew: וְהַשְּׁבִיעִ֞ת תִּשְׁמְטֶ֣נָּה וּנְטַשְׁתָּ֗הּ וְאָֽכְלוּ֙ אֶבְיֹנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְיִתְרָ֕ם תֹּאכַ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְכַרְמְךָ֖ לְזֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translit: vəhasshəvîʿith tishməṭennåh ūnəṭashtåhh vəʾåkhlū ʾevyōnē ʿammekhå vəyithråm tōʾkhal ḥayyath hassådheh kēn-taʿaseh ləkharməkhå ləzēthekhå
English: But the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie still; that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy oliveyard.

Hebrew: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת לְמַ֣עַן יָנ֗וּחַ שֽׁוֹרְךָ֙ וַחֲמֹרֶ֔ךָ וְיִנָּפֵ֥שׁ בֶּן־אֲמָתְךָ֖ וְהַגֵּֽר׃
Translit: shēsheth yåmîm taʿaseh maʿasekhå ūvayyōm hasshəvîʿî tishbōth ləmaʿan yånūaḥ shōrəkhå vaḥamōrekhå vəyinnåfēsh ben-ʾamåthkhå vəhaggēr
English: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest: that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the stranger, may be refreshed.

Hebrew: וּבְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם תִּשָּׁמֵ֑רוּ וְשֵׁ֨ם אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ לֹ֣א תַזְכִּ֔ירוּ לֹ֥א יִשָּׁמַ֖ע עַל־פִּֽיךָ׃
Translit: ūvəkhōl ʾasher-ʾåmartî ʾalēkhem tisshåmērū vəshēm ʾelōhîm ʾaḥērîm lōʾ thazkîrū lōʾ yisshåmaʿ ʿal-pîkhå
English: And in all things that I have said unto you be circumspect: and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.

Hebrew: שָׁלֹ֣שׁ רְגָלִ֔ים תָּחֹ֥ג לִ֖י בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
Translit: shålōsh rəghålîm tåḥōgh lî basshånåh
English: Three times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.

Hebrew: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִים֩ תֹּאכַ֨ל מַצּ֜וֹת כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֗ךָ לְמוֹעֵד֙ חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב כִּי־ב֖וֹ יָצָ֣אתָ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
Translit: ʾeth-ḥagh hammatṣṣōth tishmōr shivʿath yåmîm tōʾkhal matṣṣōth kaʾasher tṣivvîthikhå ləmōʿēdh ḥōdhesh håʾåvîv kî-vō yåtṣåʾthå mimmitṣråyim vəlōʾ-yēråʾū fånai rēqåm-
English: Thou shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread: (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded thee, in the time appointed of the month Abib; for in it thou camest out from Egypt: and none shall appear before me empty:)

Hebrew: וְחַ֤ג הַקָּצִיר֙ בִּכּוּרֵ֣י מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּזְרַ֖ע בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְחַ֤ג הָֽאָסִף֙ בְּצֵ֣את הַשָּׁנָ֔ה בְּאָסְפְּךָ֥ אֶֽת־מַעֲשֶׂ֖יךָ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translit: vəḥagh haqqåtṣîr bikkūrē maʿasekhå ʾasher tizraʿ bassådheh vəḥagh håʾåsif bətṣēʾth hasshånåh bəʾåspəkhå ʾeth-maʿasekhå min-hassådheh
English: And the feast of harvest, the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of ingathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the field.

Hebrew: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כָּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י הָאָדֹ֥ן יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: shålōsh pəʿåmîm basshånåh yēråʾeh kål-zəkhūrəkhå ʾel-pənē håʾådhōn ʾadhōnåi
English: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord GOD.

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִזְבַּ֥ח עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָלִ֥ין חֵֽלֶב־חַגִּ֖י עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translit: lōʾ-thizbaḥ ʿal-ḥåmētṣ dam-zivḥî vəlōʾ-yålîn ḥēlev-ḥaggî ʿadh-bōqer-
English: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.

Hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translit: rēʾshîth bikkūrē ʾadhmåthkhå tåvîʾ bēth ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhekhå lōʾ-thəvasshēl gədhî baḥalēv ʾimmō
English: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י שֹׁלֵ֤חַ מַלְאָךְ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמָרְךָ֖ בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְלַהֲבִ֣יאֲךָ֔ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲכִנֹֽתִי׃
Translit: hinnēh ʾånōkhî shōlēaḥ malʾåkh ləfånekhå lishmårkhå baddårekh vəlahavîʾakhå ʾel-hammåqōm ʾasher hakhinōthî
English: Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֧מֶר מִפָּנָ֛יו וּשְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹל֖וֹ אַל־תַּמֵּ֣ר בּ֑וֹ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִשָּׂא֙ לְפִשְׁעֲכֶ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁמִ֖י בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translit: hisshåmer mippånåv ūshəmaʿ bəqōlō ʾal-tammēr bō kî lōʾ yissåʾ ləfishʿakhem kî shəmî bəqirbō
English: Beware of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־שָׁמֹ֤עַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקֹל֔וֹ וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאָֽיַבְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְבֶ֔יךָ וְצַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־צֹרְרֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: kî ʾim-shåmōaʿ tishmaʿ bəqōlō vəʿåsîthå kōl ʾasher ʾadhabbēr vəʾåyavtî ʾeth-ʾōyəvekhå vətṣartî ʾeth-tṣōrərekhå
English: But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵלֵ֣ךְ מַלְאָכִי֮ לְפָנֶיךָ֒ וֶהֱבִֽיאֲךָ֗ אֶל־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהַפְּרִזִּי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י וְהִכְחַדְתִּֽיו׃
Translit: kî-yēlēkh malʾåkhî ləfånekhå vehevîʾakhå ʾel-håʾemōrî vəhaḥittî vəhappərizzî vəhakkənaʿanî haḥivvî vəhayvūsî vəhikhḥadhtîv-
English: For mine Angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in unto the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites: and I will cut them off.

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֤ה לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א תָֽעָבְדֵ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה כְּמַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כִּ֤י הָרֵס֙ תְּהָ֣רְסֵ֔ם וְשַׁבֵּ֥ר תְּשַׁבֵּ֖ר מַצֵּבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translit: lōʾ-thishtaḥaveh lēʾlōhēhem vəlōʾ thåʿåvdhēm vəlōʾ thaʿaseh kəmaʿasēhem kî hårēs təhårsēm vəshabbēr təshabbēr matṣṣēvōthēhem-
English: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works: but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and quite break down their images.

Hebrew: וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵרַ֥ךְ אֶֽת־לַחְמְךָ֖ וְאֶת־מֵימֶ֑יךָ וַהֲסִרֹתִ֥י מַחֲלָ֖ה מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translit: vaʿavadhtem ʾēth ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhēkhem ūvērakh ʾeth-laḥməkhå vəʾeth-mēmekhå vahasirōthî maḥalåh miqqirbekhå
English: And ye shall serve the LORD your God, and he shall bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֛ה מְשַׁכֵּלָ֥ה וַעֲקָרָ֖ה בְּאַרְצֶ֑ךָ אֶת־מִסְפַּ֥ר יָמֶ֖יךָ אֲמַלֵּֽא׃
Translit: lōʾ thihyeh məshakkēlåh vaʿaqåråh bəʾartṣekhå ʾeth-mispar yåmekhå ʾamallēʾ
English: There shall nothing cast their young, nor be barren, in thy land: the number of thy days I will fulfil.

Hebrew: אֶת־אֵֽימָתִי֙ אֲשַׁלַּ֣ח לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהַמֹּתִי֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּבֹ֖א בָּהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֧י אֶת־כָּל־אֹיְבֶ֛יךָ אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֹֽרֶף׃
Translit: ʾeth-ʾēmåthî ʾashallaḥ ləfånekhå vəhammōthî ʾeth-kål-håʿåm ʾasher tåvōʾ båhem vənåthattî ʾeth-kål-ʾōyəvekhå ʾēlekhå ʿōref-
English: I will send my fear before thee, and will destroy all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.

Hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְגֵרְשָׁ֗ה אֶת־הַחִוִּ֧י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֖י מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: vəshålaḥtî ʾeth-hatṣṣirʿåh ləfånekhå vəghērəshåh ʾeth-haḥivvî ʾeth-hakkənaʿanî vəʾeth-haḥittî milləfånekhå
English: And I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee.

Hebrew: לֹ֧א אֲגָרְשֶׁ֛נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת פֶּן־תִּהְיֶ֤ה הָאָ֨רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְרַבָּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translit: lōʾ ʾaghårshennū mippånekhå bəshånåh ʾeḥåth pen-tihyeh håʾåretṣ shəmåmåh vərabbåh ʿålekhå ḥayyath hassådheh
English: I will not drive them out from before thee in one year; lest the land become desolate, and the beast of the field multiply against thee.

Hebrew: מְעַ֥ט מְעַ֛ט אֲגָרְשֶׁ֖נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְרֶ֔ה וְנָחַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: məʿaṭ məʿaṭ ʾaghårshennū mippånekhå ʿadh ʾasher tifreh vənåḥaltå ʾeth-håʾåretṣ
English: By little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased, and inherit the land.

Hebrew: וְשַׁתִּ֣י אֶת־גְּבֻלְךָ֗ מִיַּם־סוּף֙ וְעַד־יָ֣ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמִמִּדְבָּ֖ר עַד־הַנָּהָ֑ר כִּ֣י אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּיֶדְכֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וְגֵרַשְׁתָּ֖מוֹ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: vəshattî ʾeth-gəvuləkhå miyyam-sūf vəʿadh-yåm pəlishtîm ūmimmidhbår ʿadh-hannåhår kî ʾettēn bəyedhkhem ʾēth yōshəvē håʾåretṣ vəghērashtåmō mippånekhå
English: And I will set thy bounds from the Red sea even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the river: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand; and thou shalt drive them out before thee.

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם וְלֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
Translit: lōʾ-thikhrōth låhem vəlēʾlōhēhem bərîth-
English: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאַרְצְךָ֔ פֶּן־יַחֲטִ֥יאוּ אֹתְךָ֖ לִ֑י כִּ֤י תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
Translit: lōʾ yēshəvū bəʾartṣəkhå pen-yaḥaṭîʾū ʾōthəkhå lî kî thaʿavōdh ʾeth-ʾelōhēhem kî-yihyeh ləkhå ləmōqēsh
English: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מֹשֶׁ֨ה אָמַ֜ר עֲלֵ֣ה אֶל־יְהוָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ וְאַהֲרֹן֙ נָדָ֣ב וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
Translit: vəʾel-mōsheh ʾåmar ʿalēh ʾel-ʾadhōnåi ʾattåh vəʾaharōn nådhåv vaʾavîhūʾ vəshivʿîm mizziqnē yisråʾēl vəhishtaḥavîthem mēråḥōq-
English: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto the LORD, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off.

Hebrew: וְנִגַּ֨שׁ מֹשֶׁ֤ה לְבַדּוֹ֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֣א יִגָּ֑שׁוּ וְהָעָ֕ם לֹ֥א יַעֲל֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəniggash mōsheh ləvaddō ʾel-ʾadhōnåi vəhēm lōʾ yiggåshū vəhåʿåm lōʾ yaʿalū ʿimmō
English: And Moses alone shall come near the LORD: but they shall not come nigh; neither shall the people go up with him.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר לָעָם֙ אֵ֚ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים וַיַּ֨עַן כָּל־הָעָ֜ם ק֤וֹל אֶחָד֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾ mōsheh vaysappēr låʿåm ʾēth kål-divrē ʾadhōnåi vəʾēth kål-hammishpåṭîm vayyaʿan kål-håʿåm qōl ʾeḥådh vayyōʾmərū kål-haddəvårîm ʾasher-dibber ʾadhōnåi naʿaseh
English: And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD, and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the LORD hath said will we do.

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֚ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ תַּ֣חַת הָהָ֑ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: vayyikhtōv mōsheh ʾēth kål-divrē ʾadhōnåi vayyashkēm babbōqer vayyiven mizbēaḥ taḥath håhår ūshətēm ʿesrēh matṣṣēvåh lishnēm ʿåsår shivṭē yisråʾēl
English: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶֽת־נַעֲרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּֽעֲל֖וּ עֹלֹ֑ת וַֽיִּזְבְּח֞וּ זְבָחִ֧ים שְׁלָמִ֛ים לַיהוָ֖ה פָּרִֽים׃
Translit: vayyishlaḥ ʾeth-naʿarē bənē yisråʾēl vayyaʿalū ʿōlōth vayyizbəḥū zəvåḥîm shəlåmîm laʾdhōnåi pårîm
English: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings, and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ חֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם בָּאַגָּנֹ֑ת וַחֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם זָרַ֖ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ḥatṣî haddåm vayyåsem båʾaggånōth vaḥatṣî haddåm zåraq ʿal-hammizbēaḥ
English: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basons; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ סֵ֣פֶר הַבְּרִ֔ית וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּאָזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֥ה וְנִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ sēfer habbərîth vayyiqråʾ bəʾåznē håʿåm vayyōʾmərū kōl ʾasher-dibber ʾadhōnåi naʿaseh vənishmåʿ
English: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַיִּזְרֹ֖ק עַל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה דַֽם־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרַ֤ת יְהוָה֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם עַ֥ל כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ʾeth-haddåm vayyizrōq ʿal-håʿåm vayyōʾmer hinnēh dham-habbərîth ʾasher kårath ʾadhōnåi ʿimmåkhem ʿal kål-haddəvårîm håʾēlleh
English: And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן נָדָב֙ וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: vayyaʿal mōsheh vəʾaharōn nådhåv vaʾavîhūʾ vəshivʿîm mizziqnē yisråʾēl
English: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֕וּ אֵ֖ת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְתַ֣חַת רַגְלָ֗יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה֙ לִבְנַ֣ת הַסַּפִּ֔יר וּכְעֶ֥צֶם הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָטֹֽהַר׃
Translit: vayyirʾū ʾēth ʾelōhē yisråʾēl vəthaḥath raghlåv kəmaʿasēh livnath hassappîr ūkhəʿetṣem hasshåmayim låṭōhar
English: And they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone, and as it were the body of heaven in his clearness.

Hebrew: וְאֶל־אֲצִילֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֖ח יָד֑וֹ וַֽיֶּחֱזוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translit: vəʾel-ʾatṣîlē bənē yisråʾēl lōʾ shålaḥ yådhō vayyeḥezū ʾeth-håʾelōhîm vayyōʾkhəlū vayyishtū-
English: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲלֵ֥ה אֵלַ֛י הָהָ֖רָה וֶהְיֵה־שָׁ֑ם וְאֶתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ אֶת־לֻחֹ֣ת הָאֶ֗בֶן וְהַתּוֹרָה֙ וְהַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתַ֖בְתִּי לְהוֹרֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh ʿalēh ʾēlai håhåråh vehyēh-shåm vəʾettənåh ləkhå ʾeth-luḥōth håʾeven vəhattōråh vəhammitṣvåh ʾasher kåthavtî ləhōrōthåm
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם מֹשֶׁ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ מְשָׁרְת֑וֹ וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translit: vayyåqåm mōsheh vîhōshuaʿ məshårthō vayyaʿal mōsheh ʾel-har håʾelōhîm
English: And Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua: and Moses went up into the mount of God.

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֤ים אָמַר֙ שְׁבוּ־לָ֣נוּ בָזֶ֔ה עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־נָשׁ֖וּב אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֨ה אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְחוּר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם מִי־בַ֥עַל דְּבָרִ֖ים יִגַּ֥שׁ אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translit: vəʾel-hazzəqēnîm ʾåmar shəvū-lånū våzeh ʿadh ʾasher-nåshūv ʾalēkhem vəhinnēh ʾaharōn vəḥūr ʿimmåkhem mî-vaʿal dəvårîm yiggash ʾalēhem-
English: And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man have any matters to do, let him come unto them.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְכַ֥ס הֶעָנָ֖ן אֶת־הָהָֽר׃
Translit: vayyaʿal mōsheh ʾel-håhår vaykhas heʿånån ʾeth-håhår
English: And Moses went up into the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֤ן כְּבוֹד־יְהוָה֙ עַל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַיְכַסֵּ֥הוּ הֶעָנָ֖ן שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י מִתּ֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָֽן׃
Translit: vayyishkōn kəvōdh-ʾadhōnåi ʿal-har sînai vaykhassēhū heʿånån shēsheth yåmîm vayyiqråʾ ʾel-mōsheh bayyōm hasshəvîʿî mittōkh heʿånån
English: And the glory of the LORD abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.

Hebrew: וּמַרְאֵה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה כְּאֵ֥שׁ אֹכֶ֖לֶת בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: ūmarʾēh kəvōdh ʾadhōnåi kəʾēsh ʾōkheleth bərōʾsh håhår ləʿēnē bənē yisråʾēl
English: And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָ֖ן וַיַּ֣עַל אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְהִ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ בָּהָ֔ר אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾ mōsheh bəthōkh heʿånån vayyaʿal ʾel-håhår vayhî mōsheh båhår ʾarbåʿîm yōm vəʾarbåʿîm låylåh
English: And Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
